intro: Phyllanthus croizatii, commonly known as the Madagascar false crosswort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in subtropical gardens.
